sections.title: Short title, extent and commencement
sections.content: This Act may be called the Arbitration Act, 1940. It extends to the whole of Pakistan. It shall come into force on the 1st day of July, 1940.

content.arbitration_agreement: A written agreement to submit present or future differences to arbitration, whether an arbitrator is named therein or not.
content.court: A Civil Court having jurisdiction to decide the question forming the subject-matter of the reference if the same had been the subject-matter of a suit.

sections.title: Provisions implied in arbitration agreement
sections.content: An arbitration agreement shall be deemed to include the provisions set out in the First Schedule insofar as they are applicable.

sections.title: Agreement that arbitrators be appointed by third party
sections.content: Parties to an arbitration agreement may agree that any reference thereunder shall be to an arbitrator or arbitrators appointed by a designated person.

sections.title: Authority of appointed arbitrator or umpire irrevocable except by leave of Court
sections.content: The authority of an appointed arbitrator or umpire shall not be revocable except with the leave of the Court unless stated otherwise.

sections.title: Arbitration agreement not to be discharged by death of party
sections.content: An arbitration agreement shall not be discharged by the death of any party and shall be enforceable by or against legal representatives.

sections.title: Provisions in case of insolvency
sections.content: Where an insolvent is a party to an arbitration agreement, the receiver may enforce it where applicable.

sections.title: Power of Court to appoint arbitrator or umpire
sections.content: The Court may appoint an arbitrator or umpire in certain cases, such as failure of the parties to concur on an appointment.

sections.title: Power to party to appoint new arbitrator or, in certain cases, a sole arbitrator
sections.content: A party may appoint a new arbitrator if the appointed one refuses to act, is incapable, or dies.

sections.title: Provisions as to appointment of three or more arbitrators
sections.content: In case of three arbitrators, the award of the majority shall prevail unless otherwise specified.

sections.title: Power to Court to remove arbitrators or umpire
sections.content: The Court may remove an arbitrator or umpire in certain circumstances, such as misconduct.

sections.title: Power of Court where arbitrator is removed or his authority revoked
sections.content: The Court may appoint replacements or terminate arbitration agreements where necessary.

sections.title: Powers of arbitrator
sections.content: Arbitrators may administer oaths, issue interrogatories, and correct clerical mistakes in awards.

sections.title: Award to be signed and filed
sections.content: The arbitrator shall sign and file the award in Court and notify the parties.

sections.title: Power of Court to modify award
sections.content: The Court may modify an award in case of clerical errors or issues that do not affect the decision.

sections.title: Power to remit award
sections.content: The Court may remit an award for reconsideration in cases of incompleteness or legal errors.

sections.title: Judgment in terms of award
sections.content: If no cause exists to set aside the award, the Court shall pronounce judgment in its terms.

sections.title: Power of Court to pass interim orders
sections.content: The Court may pass interim orders to prevent obstruction of execution.

sections.title: Power to supersede arbitration where award becomes void or is set aside
sections.content: The Court may order the arbitration agreement to cease if an award is void or set aside.
